text: Craig Mack, the rapper who had the first hit on P. Diddy ’ s iconic hip - hop label Bad Boy Records, died on Monday. He was 47. According to the New York Daily News, the rapper died of heart failure at his Walterboro, South Carolina home. His death was confirmed by Mack ’ s former producer Alvin Toney. “ Craig Mack, you were the first artist to release music on Bad Boy and gave us our first hit, ” Sean “ Diddy ” Combs tells Rolling Stone in a statement. “ You always followed your heart and you had an energy that was out of this world.
